worklogs.comment:
bkietz commented on pull request #6668: ARROW-8142: [C++][Compute] Explicit no chunks case for WrapDatumsLike
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6668
 
 
   When kernels which use the `WrapDatumsLike` utility on a chunked array, they invoke the ChunkedArray constructor without an explicit type. This [is forbidden for an empty chunks vector](https://github.com/bkietz/arrow/blob/1cb7a6dcbfc61a734e0e888917fa3938051de82d/cpp/src/arrow/table.h#L41) and causes an assertion failure. Since we always have access to the desired type (through Kernel::out_type), we can avoid this by passing that type to WrapDatumsLike.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6668: ARROW-8142: [C++][Compute] Explicit no chunks case for WrapDatumsLike
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6668#issuecomment-601680865
 
 
   The aborting tests seem to be limited to several tests dealing with string to dictionary conversion in `to_pandas`:
   
   python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py::TestConvertStringLikeTypes::test_table_empty_str 
   python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py::TestConvertStringLikeTypes::test_selective_categoricals 
   python/pyarrow/tests/test_pandas.py::TestConvertStringLikeTypes::test_table_str_to_categorical_without_na 
    
   Smaller reproducer:
   
   ```
   In [1]: table = pa.table([pa.array(['a', 'b'], type=pa.string())], ['col1']) 
   
   In [2]: table.to_pandas(strings_to_categorical=True)     
   terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::bad_cast'
     what():  std::bad_cast
   Aborted (core dumped)
   ```
   
   In addition, there is also one failing test (python/pyarrow/tests/test_parquet.py::test_direct_read_dictionary), which seems to be due to the table constructor loosing the type of a dictionary encoded chunked array:
   
   ```
   In [12]: chunked_array = pa.chunked_array([pa.array(["a", "b"])]).dictionary_encode()  
   
   In [13]: pa.table({'f0': chunked_array})   
   Out[13]: 
   pyarrow.Table
   f0: int32
   ```
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #6668: ARROW-8142: [C++][Compute] Explicit no chunks case for WrapDatumsLike
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6668#issuecomment-601688186
 
 
   The second failure comes from this (which might help finding the root cause):
   
   ```
   In [8]: chunked_array = pa.chunked_array([pa.array(["a", "b"])]).dictionary_encode() 
   
   In [9]: chunked_array   
   Out[9]: 
   <pyarrow.lib.ChunkedArray object at 0x7f19c6c99b88>
   [
   
     -- dictionary:
       [
         "a",
         "b"
       ]
     -- indices:
       [
         0,
         1
       ]
   ]
   
   In [10]: chunked_array.type   
   Out[10]: DataType(int32)
   
   In [11]: chunked_array.chunk(0).type
   Out[11]: DictionaryType(dictionary<values=string, indices=int32, ordered=0>)
   ``
   
   So when dicitionary encoding a chunked array, the type of the chunked array is set incorrectly (the type of the individual array chunks is correct)
   
   So I suppose that the `out_type()` passed in cast.cc::DictionaryEncode is the wrong type.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

jorisvandenbossche commented on pull request #6668: ARROW-8142: [C++][Compute] Explicit no chunks case for WrapDatumsLike
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6668#discussion_r395620191
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/hash.cc
 ##########
 @@ -591,7 +591,7 @@ Status DictionaryEncode(FunctionContext* ctx, const Datum& value, Datum* out) {
       dict_chunks.emplace_back(std::make_shared<DictionaryArray>(
           dict_type, MakeArray(datum.array()), dictionary));
     }
-    *out = detail::WrapArraysLike(value, dict_chunks);
+    *out = detail::WrapArraysLike(value, func->out_type(), dict_chunks);
 
 Review comment:
   I suppose this `out_type` is incorrect (it seems to be the type of the indices)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6668#discussion_r395768153
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/compute/kernels/hash.cc
 ##########
 @@ -591,7 +591,7 @@ Status DictionaryEncode(FunctionContext* ctx, const Datum& value, Datum* out) {
       dict_chunks.emplace_back(std::make_shared<DictionaryArray>(
           dict_type, MakeArray(datum.array()), dictionary));
     }
-    *out = detail::WrapArraysLike(value, dict_chunks);
+    *out = detail::WrapArraysLike(value, func->out_type(), dict_chunks);
 
 Review comment:
   Thanks for your thorough investigation

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When casting a schema of an empty table from dict encoded to non-dict encoded type a critical error is raised and not handled causing the interpreter to shut down.

This only happens after a parquet roundtrip

 
{code:python}
import pyarrow as pa
import pandas as pd
import pyarrow.parquet as pq

df = pd.DataFrame({"col": ["a"]}).astype({"col": "category"}).iloc[:0]
table = pa.Table.from_pandas(df)
field = table.schema[0]
new_field = pa.field(field.name, field.type.value_type, field.nullable, field.metadata)

buf = pa.BufferOutputStream()
pq.write_table(table, buf)
reader = pa.BufferReader(buf.getvalue().to_pybytes())
table = pq.read_table(reader)

schema = table.schema.remove(0).insert(0, new_field)
new_table = table.cast(schema)
assert new_table.schema == schema
 {code}
 

Output
{code:java}
WARNING: Logging before InitGoogleLogging() is written to STDERR
F0318 09:55:14.266649 299722176 table.cc:47] Check failed: (chunks.size()) > (0) cannot construct ChunkedArray from empty vector and omitted type {code}
fields.summary: [C++] Casting a chunked array with 0 chunks critical failure

comments.body:
[~fjetter] thanks for the report! 
(we have several issues with such 0-chunks chunked arrays .., eg also ARROW-7907)

A smaller reproducer without parquet (the parquet reading generated a ChunkedArray with 0 chunks instead of 1 chunk of length 0, but it's the actual 0-chunk array that causes the problem):

{code}
typ = pa.dictionary(pa.int8(), pa.string())                                                                                                                                                               
typ2 = pa.string()                      
                                                                                                                                                                  
arr = pa.chunked_array([], type=typ)             
                                                                                                                                                         
arr.cast(typ2)  
{code}
It's also not specific to dictionary, it fails for eg int8 -> int16 cast as well.
